title: Suvarna Collection saree catalog app with WhatsApp ordering

requirements.text: Create an Android-first, lightweight, beginner-friendly mobile web app UI for the saree business named “Suvarna Collection”, including a Home screen that shows the business name and an English tagline.

quotes: - Home screen with business name and tagline
Make the app beginner-friendly and lightweight.

acceptanceCriteria: On mobile widths, the Home screen loads quickly and clearly shows “Suvarna Collection” and a tagline in English
Layout uses mobile-first spacing, readable font sizes, and large tap targets
Navigation to the other sections is obvious and usable with one hand

requirements.text: Implement a Saree Catalog screen that lists products with: image, name, price, fabric, and occasion, and supports opening a Product Details view (or an expanded card) for each product.

quotes: - Saree catalog with image, name, price, fabric, occasion

acceptanceCriteria: Catalog displays at least a small seeded set of products containing all required fields (image, name, price, fabric, occasion)
Each product can be opened to view its details without losing the ability to return to the catalog
Images are displayed with consistent aspect ratio and do not cause layout shift

requirements.text: Add a “WhatsApp Order” button for each product that opens WhatsApp using a wa.me link with a pre-filled English message including the product name and price, and uses a configurable business WhatsApp/phone number.

quotes: - WhatsApp order button for each product

acceptanceCriteria: Each product card/details view includes a clearly labeled “WhatsApp Order” button
Clicking the button opens a wa.me link with a prefilled message that includes the product name and price
The WhatsApp/phone number is configurable in one obvious place (e.g., a single config constant) without code changes across multiple files

requirements.text: Create an “Offers” section and a “New Arrivals” section that show relevant products (or dedicated items) and are accessible from navigation and/or the Home screen.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can access both “Offers” and “New Arrivals” from the app navigation (and/or clear Home shortcuts)
Each section displays items with at least image, name, and price, and can link back to the same product details experience as the catalog
Seed data includes at least one Offer item and one New Arrival item

requirements.text: Create a Contact page that shows a phone number and a location (as text) and provides tap-friendly actions (e.g., click-to-call and an external maps link). Keep all user-facing text in English.

quotes: - Contact page with phone number and location
Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

acceptanceCriteria: Contact page shows a phone number and a location string
Phone number is tappable (tel: link) on mobile
Location includes an external link that opens a maps site in a new tab/window
Phone number and location are stored in a single configurable place (constants/config)

requirements.text: Apply a simple, elegant Indian design theme suitable for Indian women, using a cohesive color palette (avoid blue/purple), typography, and UI components consistently across all screens.
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent theme across Home, Catalog, Offers/New Arrivals, and Contact screens
Palette and styling feel “Indian/elegant” (e.g., warm neutrals with maroon/gold accents) without reducing readability
All primary actions (especially WhatsApp Order) have a clear visual hierarchy and accessible contrast

requirements.text: Persist and serve catalog/products (including offer/new-arrival markers) from the single Motoko backend actor, and fetch them from the frontend using React Query.

quotes: - Saree catalog with image, name, price, fabric, occasion

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes query methods to list all products and to list/filter by Offers and New Arrivals (or exposes fields that allow the frontend to filter reliably)
Frontend loads catalog data via React Query and renders loading/empty states
App functions end-to-end with seeded backend data without requiring manual data entry

requirements.text: Add generated static brand/product placeholder images into the app and render them from the frontend as static assets (do not serve images through the backend).

quotes: Make the app beginner-friendly and lightweight.

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI
Catalog items use the generated placeholder product images by default
No backend endpoints are created to serve image bytes

constraints: Use the pre-injected React + TypeScript frontend with Tailwind, shadcn/ui composition, and React Query.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo); only add migration.mo if state upgrades require it.

Do not edit frontend immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: User accounts beyond Internet Identity (no third-party auth)
Order tracking, notifications, or real-time chat
Multi-language UI (keep user-facing text in English)

required: Minimal elegant logo with a gold and maroon motif, no text (suvarna-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Subtle Indian textile pattern background, warm neutral tones (textile-pattern.dim_1440x2560.png)
Square product placeholder image resembling a folded saree on a neutral background (saree-placeholder-1.dim_800x800.png)
Square product placeholder image with a different saree colorway on a neutral background (saree-placeholder-2.dim_800x800.png)

goalsToAdd: Build a simple Android-first saree selling app for Suvarna Collection with a catalog, offers/new arrivals, contact info, and WhatsApp ordering
preferencesToAdd: Prefer lightweight, beginner-friendly UX and an elegant Indian visual theme; use English UI text
